util

Class InstancesManipulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.InstancesManipulation

  • public class InstancesManipulation
extends java.lang.Object
    Different utility functions for manipulating WEKA Instances object

      • writeArff

        public static void writeArff(java.lang.String fileName,
             weka.core.Instances instances)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the dataset to an ARFF file
        Parameters:
        fileName - path to dataset file
        instances - dataset to write to an ARFF file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file cannot be written to the desired location (e.g. the folder is missing)

      • readArff

        public static weka.core.Instances readArff(java.lang.String filename,
                           boolean setClassAndID)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads the dataset from ARFF file and tags it with id if necessary
        Parameters:
        filename - path to dataset file
        setClassAndID - if true, sets the class and id attributes
        Returns:
        the loaded dataset
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception -
        • the ARFF file is missing
        • class attribute is missing (there is no attribute in the dataset that matches the name of the class attribute given in the data properties)
        • adding an id attribute failed

      • sameInstances

        public static boolean sameInstances(weka.core.Instances dataset1,
                    weka.core.Instances dataset2)
        Checks whether two datasets contain the same instances according to ids of the instances. Instances might be described by different sets of attributes (i.e. be the two different views of the same dataset).
        Parameters:
        dataset1 - the first dataset
        dataset2 - the second dataset
        Returns:
        whether or not the supplied datasets contain the same set of instances

        Returns:

        Parameters:
        instances - dataset to remove the labels from
        Returns:

      • removeAllAttributes

        public static weka.core.Instances removeAllAttributes(weka.core.Instances instances)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Removes all attributes from the dataset except for the class and id attribute
        Parameters:
        instances - dataset to remove the attributes from
        Returns:
        dataset with removed attributes
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there was an error removing the attributes

      • removeAttributes

        public static weka.core.Instances removeAttributes(weka.core.Instances instances,
                                   java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> indices,
                                   boolean invertSelection)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Removes attributes defined by indices from the dataset
        Parameters:
        instances - dataset to remove attributes from
        indices - indices of attributes to remove from the dataset (counting from 1)
        invertSelection - if true, keep only the attributes with given indices in the dataset and remove the rest
        Returns:
        dataset with attributes removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there was an error removing the attributes (e.g. maximum attribute index is n and one of the supplied attribute indices is greater than n)

      • copyAttributes

        public static weka.core.Instances copyAttributes(weka.core.Instances origin,
                                 weka.core.Instances destination,
                                 java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> indices)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Copies attributes defined by given indices from one dataset to another
        Parameters:
        origin - the dataset to copy attributes from
        destination - the dataset to copy attributes to
        indices - inidices of attributes to copy (counting from 1)
        Returns:
        modified Instances object (datasest with added (copied) attributes)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there was an error copying the attributes (e.g. maximum attribute index is n and one of the supplied attribute indices is greater than n)

      • setTrainingSet

        public static CoTrainingData setTrainingSet(java.util.Map<java.lang.Double,java.lang.String> predictions,
                            CoTrainingData data)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Labled (training) data is defined by the prediction parameter ([id, label] pair for all labeled instances ) - modify the supplied CoTrainingData accordingly.
        For all instances belonging to the labeled data in CoTrainingData object:
        • if the instance is not present in predictions - delete it from the labeled data
        • if the instance is present in predictions - re-label it if necessary
        For all instances belonging to the unlabeled data in CoTrainingData object:
        • if present in predictions - label it and move it to the labeled data
        Parameters:
        predictions - class attribute value for each instance that should be in the labeled dataset. Key: instance id, value: label for that instance
        data - co-training data object (labeled, unlabeled and test data)
        Returns:
        the modified CoTrainingData object: data is labeled according to the supplied label set (predictions parameter)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if some of the instances defined by predictions parameter are missing in both labeled and unlabeled data

      • removeAllInstances

        public static weka.core.Instances removeAllInstances(weka.core.Instances instances)
        Removes all instances from the dataset
        Parameters:
        instances - dataset to remove the instances from
        Returns:
        the empty dataset

      • removeAllInstances

        public static weka.core.Instances[] removeAllInstances(weka.core.Instances[] instances)
        Removes all instances from the dataset represented with several views
        Parameters:
        instances - dataset to remove the instances from
        Returns:
        the empty dataset

      • setTestSet

        public static CoTrainingData setTestSet(java.util.Map<java.lang.Double,java.lang.String> predictions,
                        CoTrainingData data)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Test data is defined by the predictions parameter ([id, label] pair for all test instances) - modify the supplied CoTrainingData accordingly. For example, it is used in RSSalg for out-of-bag evaluation.
        For all instances previously belonging to the test data in CoTrainingData object - remove them.
        For all instances belonging to the labeled data in CoTrainingData object - if present in predictions, re-label if necessary and move to test data
        For all instances belonging to the unlabeled data in CoTrainingData object - if present in predictions, label and move to test data
        Parameters:
        predictions - class attribute value for each instance that should be in the test dataset. Key: instance id, value: label for that instance
        data - co-training data object (labeled, unlabeled and test data)
        Returns:
        the modified CoTrainingData object: test data is modified according to the supplied set (predictions parameter)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if some of the instances defined by predictions parameter are missing in both labeled and unlabeled data

      • getMerged

        public static weka.core.Instances getMerged(weka.core.Instances[] dataset)
        Merged the views in the unique attribute set. Each view (Instances object from the array) should contain the same number of instances, described by different attribute sets.
        Parameters:
        dataset - different views of one dataset
        Returns:
        dataset with a unique attribute set

      • getNumberOfInstancesWithAttValue

        public static int getNumberOfInstancesWithAttValue(weka.core.Instances instances,
                                   java.lang.String attName,
                                   java.lang.String attValue)
        Returns the number of instances that have the certain value of an attribute
        Parameters:
        instances - the dataset
        attName - the name of the attribute
        attValue - the value of the attribute
        Returns:
        the number of instances from the dataset who have the given value for this attribute
